conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a romantic fantasy movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Based on your preferences for romantic fantasy movies, I recommend you watch "What Dreams May Come" (1998) directed by Christopher Newton. This movie is about a man who dies in an accident and enters Heaven. But when he discovers that his beloved wife Annie has killed herself out of grief over the loss, he embarks on an afterlife adventure to reunite with her.
The other movie I recommend you watch is "The Adjustment Bureau" (2011) directed by Paul Thomas Anderson. This movie is about a man who dies in an accident and enters Heaven. But when he discovers that his beloved wife Annie has killed herself out of grief over the loss, he embarks on an afterlife adventure to reunite with her.
However, you can also choose to watch "The Beastmaster" (1982) directed by Roger Vadim. This movie is about a sword- and- sorcery fantasy about a young man' s search for revenge. Armed with supernatural powers, the handsome hero and his animal allies wage war against marauding forces.
This movie has been well-received by both critics and audiences alike and it is considered to be one of the greatest sword-and-sorcery fantasy movies ever made.
I hope this recommendation helps you enjoy watching these great romantic fantasy movies.

1. "In the Company of Men" (1997) - This movie follows two business executives who seek revenge on the female gender.

2. "Without Remorse" (1993) - This movie is an adaptation of James Michener's novel "The Rainmaker." The movie follows a former Marine named Michael Coretti, who returns to his hometown in South Carolina during the American Civil War era to try to make amends for what he did as a Marine.

3. "The Santa Clause 2" (2002) - This movie is a sequel to the 1997 film "In the Company of Men." The movie follows two business executives named Scott Calvin and Sarah Hall, who travel to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.
